reviews.review: Un pequeño balance en la actividad cooperativa y sería la mejor experiencia que cuatro personas podrian tener... muy pocas mecanicas entre personajes pero... queda compensado por la dificultad y experiencia que crea en apoyarse unas cuantas horas en el juego, ademas de que jugar solo no lo convierte en aburrido. Esta bien equilibrado.

Left 4 Dead 1 is one less than Left 4 Dead 2, but despite that is still an ace game.

There was a lot of stuff added in the second game, but the formula was already perfect. And that's not to say the sequel is bad, it's not, both of them are fantastic games.

Still, I don't know if it's worth buying the first game anymore. There's a 'Left 4 Dead 1 coop' mutation for L4D2 that literally just makes the game play just like the first one. On top of this, all of the campaigns have been officially ported over by Valve themselves, so... I guess if you REALLY BADLY want that PURITY of Left 4 Dead 1, you might consider buying this, but otherwise just grab the second game.

That said, they changed some things with weapons around in the second game, most notably I don't think you actually have to count your shotgun rounds off if you're using the XM1014, because the reload is always the same speed. And the addition of 'more guns' is nice, but again, you only need the five or so weapons that L4D1 offers. You have your M16, your XM1014, Uzi, pump shotgun. That's really all you need. Anything more just 'bloats' the game, in a way.

Sometimes, less is more.

Either way, I can't possibly not recommend this game, because, come on, it's Left 4 Dead, the sceond game releasing didn't MAGICALLY warp time and space and cause the first game to be bad.

A diferença entre Left 4 Dead e outro jogo de zumbi é que nesse jogo os zumbis simplesmente querem a sua bunda pq além deles sairem correndo pra porra na sua direção tem os Zumbis especiais que são: Boomer o gordo que vomita em vc para atrair ou outros zumbis, Smoker o zumbi que te puxa lá da merda com a lingua de fumante dele, Hunter um fdp q fica pulando e gritando na sua direção e se ele te pegar se ta fudido , Whitch a emo com as unha gigante,ela é pacifica mas se vc chegar perto pacifica vai ser a ultima coisa que ela vai ser e finalmente o Tank basicamente o Boss, é um grandão bombado com a lingua pra fora, e se tiver um carro perto dele se prepara pq ele vai sair voando na sua direção. Amo esse jogo...

Vale a pena!

"Давно устаревший симулятор зомбятины".

Когда-то я имел удовольствие от игры, вот только оно было при покупке и через 1-2 часа надоело. Ничего сложного в ней нет. Просто ходи и стреляй. Нет прокачек, но есть разнообразия зомби (Жаль, что не оружия). 
Карты серые и унылые, движок устаревший. Единственное, что эту игру спасает - это кооператив. Там не так скучно, как в сингле.

Если вы хотите действительно пострелять, минимум купите вторую часть, а максимум "Dying Light". Ели-ели 4/10.

A classic game for young Xb360 fans that didn't have an internet connection. Hours on end going through each campaign, each difficulty, each character (everyone had their own favourite at heart though). I didn't think anyone would be looking for a review on a game which had came out in 2008. The game logic itself is simple. You can kill zombies, zombies can kill you. Francis, Bill, Zoey and Louis are the 4 unfortunate characters, of which 1 of these 4 you can play as. Are trying to make their way out of the pre-1950's city of Fairfield and into safety. While navigating your way (pretty easily) through city rooftops, chaotic streets, eerie sewers, collapsed train lines, and eventually a dilapidated hospital. In which you encounter the end of the first campaign. 

The journey there should prepare you for what seems to be a reoccuring fashion in Left 4 Dead. I don't see this trend as boring, or mind numbing; but a change of scenery to the carnage that ensues as 3 bots and a trigger happy teen eliminate endless wave after wave of the undead. It posses some what of a challenge, but nothing that would leave you stuck on the same most recent save for days on end. 

If i was to recommend this to someone, it would be a young cousin or a friends' little brother. I enjoy L4D & L4D2 even now as an 18 Year old. But games that bring as much happyness as this has done for me should be enojyed at a young age. Before responsibilities become more prevalent.

(The good) of this game is the world and the end of the world with the undead trying to kill you at every given chance 

(The Bad) The AI are terrible if you are trying to beat all expert levels! 
          The players are not any better by any means and love to quit after they fail a couple of times.
          If you are going to fight by my side on expert, stop quiting! It can take up to 5 hours or more     
          I'm not going to K.I.C.K you for failing a few times, as long as you are trying your best  
          It amazes how far this game has gone down since its release in 2008 with these nasty  
          Players.
          I beat one expert level with rookies who didn't give up just resent but it took us around 5 
          Hours but we did it even after trying over and over again. 
          You have to have patience sometimes but you try telling that to kids under 18

          If you plan on beating this on expert. Get friends or make some, because you won't be  
          Able to.
          Still a great game but you will get bored real fast with most of the players being nasty
          People and ruining it for you

Left 4 Dead is the definitive zombie game that still holds up to this day. The maps are fun and memorable the animations really bring out the weapons. However the characters are for the most part dull and uninteresting. Also since the game was released so long ago Left 4 Dead does not support the Steam workshop. But if you can look past all that than I think you will enjoy this amazing title. I would go as far to say that Left 4 Dead is better than it's sequel. All in all this is a great game with a great fan base. I thoroughly enjoyed this one.

Edit: Looking at this now I realize that the characters are actually pretty well written with maybe the exception of Francis. Also the weapon animations leave a lot to be desired.

Left 4 Dead has never ceased to be fun. Playing the game now it's clear it's aging. It's a great game that's just been made shallow by other newer co op experiences. Still a great time with friends, but I emphasize WITH FRIENDS. Pairing up with other players randomly will only result in an awful experience where no one seems to know how to work together or even know what their objective is. Save yourself the frustration and only play with friends.
